hint.en:
Lifeline. 
Sends Device Reset notifications, and Central Scene notifications.
Basic Report Pushbutton 1
Switch Binary Set Pushbutton 1
Switch Multilevel Set Pushbutton 1
Basic Report Pushbutton 2
Switch Binary Set Pushbutton 2
Switch Multilevel Set Pushbutton 2
Basic Report Pushbutton 3
Switch Binary Set Pushbutton 3
Switch Multilevel Set Pushbutton 3
Basic Report Pushbutton 4
Switch Binary Set Pushbutton 4
Switch Multilevel Set Pushbutton 4
Basic Report Dimmer device
Pushbutton 1 controls the dimmer
Pushbutton 2 controls the dimmer
Pushbutton 3 controls the dimmer
Pushbutton 4 controls the dimmer

This parameter specifies the duration of a full regulation of the light from 0% to 100%. A regulation of the light with 1% will take 1/100 of the specified duration. This is used when a pushbutton is held-down for controlling the dimming, and when the dimming is fulfilled from other Z-Wave devices.

A value of 0 is immediately.
Values from 1 - 127 is duration in seconds.
Values from 128 - 255 is duration in minutes (minus 127).

This parameter specifies the duration when turning the light on or off.

A value of 0 is immediately.
Values from 1 - 127 is duration in seconds.
Values from 128 - 255 is duration in minutes (minus 127).

The dimmer can work in three different modes:
- No dimming, only on/off (0/100%)
- leading edge dimming
- trailing edge dimming
This parameter specifies the actual level of the dimmer output when set to 0%.
This parameter specifies the actual level of the dimmer output when set to 99%.
This parameter can be used for disabling Central Scene notifications.
This parameter enables or disables double activation of pushbuttons.
This parameter can be used for disabling the Z-Wave network add/remove process when triple-activating pushbutton 1.
This parameter can be used for enabling the enhanced LED control. See document about MATRIX enhanced LED control.
Pushbutton input debounce time in 0.01 seconds resolution.
Specifies the time that a pushbutton must be activated before it is detected as pressed. Resolution is in 0.01 seconds.
Specifies the time that a pushbutton must have been activated before it is accepted as “held-down”. Resolution is 0.01 seconds.
Global brightness control for red color with intensity from 0 to 255
Global brightness control for green color with intensity from 0 to 255
Global brightness control for blue color with intensity from 0 to 255

label.en: Associations groups, transmission when included secure

hint.en: Association group 2, sent as secure
Association group 3, sent as secure
Association group 4, sent as secure
Association group 5, sent as secure
Association group 6, sent as secure
Association group 7, sent as secure
Association group 8, sent as secure
Association group 9, sent as secure
Association group 10, sent as secure
Association group 11, sent as secure
Association group 12, sent as secure
Association group 13, sent as secure
Association group 14, sent as secure

This parameter specifies the functionality of pushbutton 1. The values are:
- Standard toggle-function, the state is switched between on and off, dimming up and down
- Automatic turn off after the time has expired (staircase lighting function), the time is specified in the next configuration parameter
- Automatic turn on after the time has expired, the time is specified in the next configuration parameter
- Always turn off or dim down . Using this parameter, the pushbutton can only send ‘off’ or ‘dim down’ commands. Use this in pair with another pushbutton with value 4 (see chapter 2.6 in the manual)
- Always turn on or dim up. Using this parameter, the pushbutton can only send ‘on’ or ‘dim up’ commands. Use this in pair with another pushbutton with value 3 (see chapter 2.6 in the manual)

label.en: Always turn off or dim down
Always turn on or dim up

hint.en: This parameter specifies the time used in previous configuration parameter. This parameter is only applicable if pushbutton 1 funktionality is set to one of the automatic turn off/on time values.

This parameter specifies how received Binary Switch Set commands are handled.
Possible values are:
- Binary Switch Set only controls the pushbutton indicator LEDs, ON/OFF
- Binary Switch Set controls the internal switch status and the pushbutton indicator LEDs
- Binary Switch Set is handled as if the user had activated the pushbutton, including transmission of commands via the association groups

This parameter specifies how the LED indication is controlled.
Possible values are:
- Internal LED control is disabled, only external commands control the indication
- The LED indication follows the switch status
- The LED indication follows the switch status – with inverted functionality
- Same as: The LED indication follows the switch status
- Same as: The LED indication follows the switch status – with inverted functionality
- The LED indication follows the status of the internal dimmer, ON or OFF
- The LED indication follows the status of the internal dimmer with inverted functionality, ON or OFF
- The LED indicator is ON for 5 seconds when the pushbutton is activated

This parameter specifies how Command Class Switch Color commands are handled.
Possible values are:
- Direct control; the LED indication shows the received colour immediately, until the pushbutton is activated
- Colour command sets the colour for OFF indication
- Colour command sets the colour for ON indication

This parameter specifies the saturation levels for the red, green and blue LEDs, when ON status is indicated. (Default is the ON-state indicated by a 50% blue colour).
Byte 1: Colour saturation, red.
Byte 2: Colour saturation, green.
Byte 3: Colour saturation, blue.
Byte 4: LED control.
Control red color with intensity from 0 to 255. (Default is 0)
Control green color with intensity from 0 to 255. (Default is 0)
Control blue color with intensity from 0 to 255. (Default is 127)

LED indicator control; see the application note about this parameter. (Default is 0)
Value range from 0 to 255.

This parameter specifies the saturation levels for the red, green and blue LEDs, when OFF status is indicated. (Default is the OFF-state indicated as a low white light on 5%).
Byte 1: Colour saturation, red.
Byte 2: Colour saturation, green.
Byte 3: Colour saturation, blue.
Byte 4: LED control.
Control red color with intensity from 0 to 255. (Default is 47)
Control green color with intensity from 0 to 255. (Default is 47)
Control blue color with intensity from 0 to 255. (Default is 47)

LED indicator control; see the application note about this parameter. (Default is 0)
Value range from 0 to 255.

This parameter specifies the functionality of pushbutton 2. The values are:
- Standard toggle-function, the state is switched between on and off, dimming up and down
- Automatic turn off after the time has expired (staircase lighting function), the time is specified in the next configuration parameter
- Automatic turn on after the time has expired, the time is specified in the next configuration parameter
- Always turn off or dim down . Using this parameter, the pushbutton can only send ‘off’ or ‘dim down’ commands. Use this in pair with another pushbutton with value 4 (see chapter 2.6 in the manual)
- Always turn on or dim up. Using this parameter, the pushbutton can only send ‘on’ or ‘dim up’ commands. Use this in pair with another pushbutton with value 3 (see chapter 2.6 in the manual)

label.en: Always turn off or dim down
Always turn on or dim up

Value range from 0 to 255.
